list.abs: When we call a girl buxom we mean that she is fat ., 当我们要求一个女孩鼓起我们的意思 , 她是脂肪.
the chief operator , a buxom lady of forty or so with a heavy southern accent , brightened when pug mentioned lacouture .总接线员是个四十岁左右，南方口音很重的长得丰满的女人。帕格提到拉古秋时，她神情就活泼起来了。

a generation ago , fat babies were considered healthy and buxom actresses were popular , but society has since come to worship thinness & b { Robert A.Hamilton在上一代，肥胖婴儿被认为是健康的，丰满的女演员受欢迎，但自那以后，瘦削已变得更加为人们所称道了(罗伯特A.汉密尔顿)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from the stem of Old English  būgan 'to bend' (see bow) + -someThe original sense was 'compliant, obliging', later 'lively and good-tempered', influenced by the traditional association of plumpness and good health with an easy-going nature

entry.def: If you describe a woman as buxom, you mean that she looks healthy and attractive and has a rounded body and big breasts.

example.ex: Melissa was a tall, buxom blonde.
example.tran: 梅利莎是个丰满的高个子金发美女。

means.word_mean: 1. (of a woman's body) having a large bosom and pleasing curves;

sentences.sentence: "a curvy young woman in a tight dress"
"a generation ago...buxom actresses were popular"- Robt.A.Hamilton
